plans.title: Char Dham Yatra Package (ex Haridwar)
plans.disp:
Char Dham Yatra is a popular pilgrimage circuit in India, which includes four holy Hindu temples located in the state of Uttarakhand. The temples are Yamunotri, Gangotri, Kedarnath, and Badrinath. The yatra usually takes around 10 to 12 days to complete, but there are also shorter versions of the yatra that cover the four temples in a shorter duration.

For your group of seventeen people, you have opted for a 9-day and 8-night Char Dham Yatra plan, which is a condensed version of the full yatra. This plan is designed to cover all four temples in a shorter duration, without compromising on the spiritual significance and beauty of the locations.
The plan includes only transport by a private vehicle from Jolly Grant Airport Dehradun or Dehradun railway station to Haridwar, which is the starting point of the yatra. ex Haridwar, you will travel to the four temples, staying overnight at different locations along the way. (in this plan include only transport charges)
The total cost for this plan is 1,18,000 rupees , includes all transport, However, this cost does not include any personal expenses such as shopping or extra activities.
Overall, this plan offers a convenient and affordable way to experience the spiritual and natural beauty of the Char Dham Yatra. It is a great option for those who have limited time but still want to experience the holy temples and the stunning Himalayan scenery

plans.title: Char Dham Yatra + Tungnath Package
plans.disp:
Char Dham Yatra is a popular pilgrimage circuit in India, which includes four holy Hindu temples located in the state of Uttarakhand. The temples are Yamunotri, Gangotri, Kedarnath, and Badrinath.

The yatra usually takes around 10 to 12 days to complete, but there are also shorter versions of the yatra that cover the four temples in a shorter duration.

For your group of thirteen people,you have opted for a 9-day and 8-night Char Dham Yatra plan, which is a condensed version of the full yatra. This plan is designed to cover all four temples in a shorter duration, without compromising on the spiritual significance and beauty of the locations.
The plan includes only transport by a private vehicle from Jolly Grant Airport Dehradun or Dehradun railway station to Haridwar, which is the starting point of the yatra. ex Haridwar, you will travel to the four temples, staying overnight at different locations along the way. (in this plan include only transport charges)
The total cost for this plan is 99,000 rupees , includes all transport, However, this cost does not include any personal expenses such as shopping or extra activities.
Overall, this plan offers a convenient and affordable way to experience the spiritual and natural beauty of the Char Dham Yatra. It is a great option for those who have limited time but still want to experience the holy temples and the stunning Himalayan scenery
plans.itenary:
Day 01: Haridwar – Barkot/ Karsali (205 Km / 7 to 8 hrs)
 
This morning depart for Barkot, located on the foot of Yamunotri. On arrival at Barkot, check-in to your hotel/camp. Rest of the day is free to relax and store your energy for the Pahad Yatra of Yamunotri the next day.
 
Day 02: Barkot/ Kharsali– Yamunotri – Barkot/Kharsali (48 Km / 2 hrs or Start trek)
 
Yamunotri is the source of the river Yamuna, the twin sister of Varna, the Lord of Death. Yamuna is also the daughter of Surya the Sun. The actual source of the river originates from Champasar Glacier 1 km a head of the shrine, at an altitude of 4,321 mts.
 
Day 03: Barkot/ Kharsali – Uttarkashi (85 Km/ 3 hrs Journey)
 
After breakfast check out from the Barkot hotel and drive to Uttarkashi. On arrival check in into the hotel. Uttarkashi is situated on the banks of river Bhagirathi and is famous for its historical monuments, Temples & Ashrams.
 
Day 04: Uttarkashi – Gangotri – Uttarkashi (100 Km / 3 to 4 hrs)
 
Nestled in the magnificent Garhwal Himalayas, Gangotri is set at an altitude of 3048 mts. Upon arrival at Gangotri take a holy dip in the sacred river Ganges which is also called Bhagirathi at its origin Visit the Gangotri Temple. Ganga is believed to have touched earth at this spot.
 
Day 05: Uttarkashi – Guptkashi (190 Km / 7 to 8 hrs)
 
After early morning breakfast check out from the hotel and drive for Guptkashi. On arrival check in at hotel. Rest of the day free to explore the Guptkashi town. Dinner and Overnight stay in Guptkashi hotel/Camps.
 
Day 06: Guptkashi – Sonprayag – Kedarnath (30 Km + 20 Km trek)
 
Early morning after breakfast check out from the hotel and drive to Sonprayag.ex Haridwar, you will start your 20 km trek to Kedarnath. Mandakini, one of the main tributaries of the Ganges originates at Kedarnath and flows through Gaurikund. Dinner and Overnight at Govt.
 
Day 07: Kedarnath – Sonprayag – Guptkashi/Rudraprayag (20 Km trek + 30 Km / 52 Kms drive)
 
Early morning you get up before dawn and after taking bath you are at the temple by 4:45 am for the 'Abhishek' to Kedarnath Shiva. After darshan and puja you come out of the temple and return to the Camps / Lodges. The vehicles wait for you in Sonprayag Car Parking and you will drive to your hotel.
 
Day 08: Rudraprayag / Guptkashi – Joshimath – Badrinath (190 Km 0r 240 Kms / 8to 9 hrs)
 
This morning, you check out of the hotel at 08:00 am and drive to Badrinath via Joshimath. After some rest and refreshments, you are all set to go to Badrinath Temple for darshan in the evening. But first you have to go to Tapt Kund , take bath and then go to the temple.
 
Day 9: Badrinath – Joshimath – Rudraprayag/Birahi/Srinagar (165 Km / 5 to 6 hrs)
 
After darshan return back to hotel, breakfast at hotel and proceed for Badrinath local sightseeing visit Mana Village, Vyas Gufa, Ganesh Gufa, and Mata Murti temple. Rudraprayag is a small pilgrim town on the holy confluence of river Alaknanda and Mandakini. Dinner and Overnight stay at hotel.
 
Day 10: Birahi/Srinagar/ Rudraprayag – Rishikesh / Haridwar (160 Km / 5 to 6 hrs)
 
Early morning, after breakfast, you drive downhill to Rishikesh a spiritual city and the Yoga capital of the world. On reaching Rishikesh you'll do the Rishikesh sightseeing visit Ram Jhula and Laxman Jhula. Evening drive to Haridwar. On arrival check in at hotel. Dinner and Overnight stay at hotel.
 
Note
Maybe you must start your journey early in the morning cause of same day Darshan.
Early journey may become cause of breakfast loss.
plans.tandc:
* All correspondence(s) in respect of Tour Service bookings should be addressed to visituttrakhand.in

* Cancellation charges would be as per the company policy.

* Vehicle confirmed will be as per Itinerary and not at disposal. AC will work only in the plains and will be switched off during hill drives.

* All sightseeing mentioned are subject to weather conditions, political conditions & traffic conditions in the destination.

* Any sightseeing missed due to natural calamities / weather conditions is non-refundable.

* All entrances fees will be on direct payment basis as per Itinerary

* It is not advisable to travel in night, if necessary, supplement charge applicable
plans.incAndExe:
INCLUSIONS

* Sightseeing as per the itinerary
* All Transfers, excursions & sightseeing as per the itinerary by private car in Package
* Parking and all transport related expense including Driver Services
* All toll taxes, parking fees, Fuel and driver's allowances
* All Transport Related Taxes.
* No Hidden Cost

EXCLUSIONS
* 5% GST (Government Service Tax)
* Personal expenses such as laundry, telephone calls, tips & gratuity, mineral water, soft & hard drinks, porterage.
* Anything not mentioned in the inclusions
* If heater required in cold places charge will be extra as per hotel policy.
* Charges of Animal Riding, Cable Car & Shikara Ride, Water Rafting, Boating, Trekking etc.
* Additional sightseeing or extra usage of vehicle, other than mentioned in the itinerary
* Entrance Fees & Guide charges
* Any cost arising due to flight cancellation or natural calamities like, landslides, road blockage, political disturbances (strikes), etc (to be borne by the client, who is directly payable on the spot)
* Any increase in Airlines taxes or fuel price at the time of departure, leading to increase in cost on surface transportation & land arrangements, which may come into effect prior to departure
* Still camera/ video camera charger
plans.cancelPolicy:
In the event of cancellation of tour / travel services due to any avoidable / unavoidable reason/s we must be notified of the same in writing. Cancellation charges will be effective from the date we receive advice in writing, and cancellation charges would be as follows:
* 20% of full tour cost - 60 days prior to arrival.
* 30% of full tour cost - 30 days prior to arrival.
* 50% of full tour cost - between 15 & 29 days prior to tour.
* 75% of full tour cost - between 14 & 7 days prior to tour
* 100% - within 7 days prior to tour.
plans.paymentPolicy:
Mode of Payment: Advance payment can be made through Transfer to our bank.
* Deposit of 25% of the package cost at the time of booking.
* Need 50% payment of the package cost, 30 days prior to departure date
* Need 100% payment of the package cost, 15 days prior to departure date
Apart from above in some cases like Special Train Journeys, hotels or resorts bookings during the peak season (X-Mas, New Year), full payment is required to be sent in advance.

plans.title: Char Dham Yatra + Tungnath + Rishikesh
plans.disp:
Char Dham Yatra is a popular pilgrimage circuit in India, which includes four holy Hindu temples located in the state of Uttarakhand. The temples are Yamunotri, Gangotri, Kedarnath, and Badrinath. The yatra usually takes around 10 to 12 days to complete, but there are also shorter versions of the yatra that cover the four temples in a shorter duration.

For your group of four people, you have opted for a 9-day and 8-night Char Dham Yatra plan, which is a condensed version of the full yatra. This plan is designed to cover all four temples in a shorter duration, without compromising on the spiritual significance and beauty of the locations.
The plan includes only transport by a private vehicle from Jolly Grant Airport Dehradun or Dehradun railway station to Haridwar, which is the starting point of the yatra. ex Haridwar, you will travel to the four temples, staying overnight at different locations along the way. (in this plan include only transport charges)
The total cost for this plan is 50,000 rupees , includes all transport, However, this cost does not include any personal expenses such as shopping or extra activities.
Overall, this plan offers a convenient and affordable way to experience the spiritual and natural beauty of the Char Dham Yatra. It is a great option for those who have limited time but still want to experience the holy temples and the stunning Himalayan scenery

plans.title: Do Dham Yatra Package ( ex Haridwar)
plans.disp:
Char Dham Yatra is a popular pilgrimage circuit in India, which includes four holy Hindu temples located in the state of Uttarakhand. The temples are Yamunotri, Gangotri, Kedarnath, and Badrinath. The yatra usually takes around 10 to 12 days to complete, but there are also shorter versions of the yatra that cover the two temples (badrinath and kedarnath)in a shorter duration.

For your group of thirteen people, you have opted for a 5-day and 4-night Char Dham Yatra plan, which is a condensed version of the full yatra. This plan is designed to cover all four temples in a shorter duration, without compromising on the spiritual significance and beauty of the locations.
